description.narrative: Reduction of the continuous shortages of cement in the country allowing regular supply of quality cement and at much more affordable prices. Transfer of technological know-how Employment generation - Onsite staff training 7.6%. Demonstration Effect Positive climate change effect.

The project consists of the building and operation in Guinea Bissau, of a 200,000 ton per annum greenfield cement grinding mill based on imported clinker. The rationale behind the project consists of: (i) cement import substitution in a country featured by continuous cement shortage and the inexistence of domestic production and high transportation costs; (ii) no opportunity for local clinker production as Guinea Bissau lacks of limestone reserves; (iii) good fit with a first-class sponsor like HeidelbergCement with dominant position in most of its markets; (iv) increasing market which can be expanded with the potential in the surrounding regions of South Senegal and North Guinea; (v) first mover advantage as Cardoz Cimentos de Bissau will be the first cement plant of the country; (vi) plant location in an area which currently absorbs 50% of the country cement consumption; and (vii) lower transportation costs.
